alert.note: Alert for Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Western Addison; Western Chittenden (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 2:12PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Essex, northeastern Addison and central Chittenden Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 212 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Willsboro, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Essex Junction, South Burlington, Burlington International Airport, Burlington, Willsboro, Charlotte, Winooski, Essex Junction Village, Williston, Richmond, Jericho, Hinesburg, St. George, Huntington, Essex, Jericho Village, Shelburne, Colchester, Underhill and Starksboro. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 74 and 93. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Western Addison; Western Chittenden
